text:
Loehr, Mrs. John
Hugo, IL 1905

Instructions: Fill in all such of this questionnaire as you can and will.

1. The following questions:

   a. What year did you start homesteading in eastern Canada?
   b. Where did you set up housekeeping?
   c. How many acres have you been living on before that?
   d. How many people did you prepare food for?
   e. How far are you from your nearest store?
   f. How often could a visit be made to the store?

2. Flour and other grain products:

   a. What brand of wheat flour did you use in the early years?
   b. In what quantity did you buy it?
   c. What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour?
   d. How much did you use (per head)?
   e. What flour did you use locally?
   f. How far away?
   g. What other grain products did you use?
   h. Cornmeal?
   i. Oats?
   j. Did you grind your own wheat for milling?
   k. How did you grind it?

   Note: All answers should be written on this sheet.
Loehr, Mrs. John
Hugalletta, N.Y.
